subject: Travel
title: Tipping Gone Global
description: A quick win: understand Tipping Gone Global.

hook.text: American tipping culture is spreading worldwide, and many countries don't want it.

buildup.text: Tourism exports tipping expectations. Hotels in Bali and restaurants in Paris now see tip jars appear.

discovery.text: Japan, South Korea, and China have traditionally rejected tipping. Younger workers now expect it in tourist zones.

twist.text: Digital payment screens now prompt tips at coffee shops where tipping never existed before.

climax.text: Some restaurants in the US are banning tips entirely and paying servers higher base wages instead.

punchline.text: Tipping culture is spreading where it's not wanted and retreating where it started.

quiz.question: How is tipping culture changing globally?
options: Spreading to countries that traditionally reject it
